entry.title: Combined summary - New Output Script Type
entry.summary: The email thread discusses the possibility of embedding data in the blockchain as a hash, which has been made possible by services like Proof of Existence and sx-embed-addr. The author proposes creating a new payment type called "embed_hash" to support this feature. This unspendable payment type would include a script with a single 20 byte push data, offering optimization possibilities and avoiding indexing Bitcoin addresses used for data indexing. The idea is to separate this class of Bitcoin usage from normal Bitcoin addresses to improve the core Bitcoin payments system.In September 2013, a proposal was suggested on the Bitcoin-development mailing list to create a new payment type that would be unspendable and could be used to support embedding data in the blockchain as a hash. Jeff Garzik, Senior Software Engineer and open source evangelist at BitPay, Inc., provided the context for this proposal in his email response, which included links to sources supporting the idea of embedding data in the blockchain as a hash. The proposal suggests creating a script with a single 20 byte push data which would have optimization possibilities and avoid indexing in an address database Bitcoin addresses which are currently being used to index data.By separating this class of Bitcoin usage, it can improve the core Bitcoin payments system. However, the email ends with an unrelated advertisement for ServiceNow's IT transformation services. Overall, the proposal aims to optimize the use of Bitcoin addresses and improve the functionality of the Bitcoin system.
